result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:19 AM Defendant Derek James Larosh in court.  Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court for Derek James Larosh.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin. Matter set over.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:04 AM Defendant Derek James Larosh in court, in custody.  Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court for Derek James Larosh.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing. Waiver of preliminary hearing filed with the Court. The Court accepts the waiver. Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial. ADA provides the court and defense a paper copy of the information. Defendant waives reading of information. Not Guilty plea entered on all counts. Matter set over.

1:16 PM Defendant Derek James Larosh appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Laura Kohl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Jane Krueger Smith appears on behalf of the defendant for bond purposes only. Court advises defendant of rights. Court advises defendant of charges and penalties. Defendant given complaint. Bond set along with bond conditions. Court gives a $1000.00 cash bond and a $9000.00 signature bond. The Court states if the DE can find someone to cosign The Court would be willing to amend. The DE is to reach out to the PD office if he would like them as counsel.
